answerText: Mount Cotopaxi[10] You can visit the El Misti stratovolcano near Arequipa in this country, or you can visit part of the Amazonian Rain forest near Iquitos. Lake Titicaca also lies on its northern border.
heading: ACF Fall |2008 | Brown | 5 | Geography | None | College
subject: Geography
question: Question: Identify these locations in South America which are noted for their volcanic activity, for 10 points each. [10]  In 1877, this volcano erupted, killing over 1000 people. At 19,347 feet, it is the world's highest continuously active volcano.
